Name: adenoiditis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease which involves inflammation

Name: laryngotracheitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease involving inflammation of both larynx and trachea often caused by viral infection. The infection can close off the windpipe.

Name: uvulitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease characterized by the swelling of the uvula to 3-5 times its normal size.

Name: adenoid hypertrophy
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease characterized by the unusual growth of the adenoid tonsil; has symptom snoring

Name: leprosy
Definition: A primary bacterial infectious disease that results_in infection located_in superficial peripheral nerves

Name: obsolete malignant neoplasm of pelvis
Definition: A primary bacterial infectious disease that results_in infection located_in superficial peripheral nerves

Name: tonsillitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease which is characterized by inflammation of the tonsils resulting from bacterial (Group A streptococcus) and viral (Epstein-Barr virus

Name: common cold
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease which involves inflammation of the mucous membranes of the nose

Name: acute laryngopharyngitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease which involves inflammation of both larynx and pharynx.

Name: pharyngitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease involving inflammation of the throat or pharynx resulting from bacterial

Name: nose disease
Definition: A lung disease that is defined as a recurrent or chronic collapse of the right middle lobe

Name: tracheal disease
Definition: A spinal cord disease that is characterized by inflammation of the white matter or gray matter of the spinal cord.

Name: laryngeal disease
Definition: A histiocytic and dendritic cell cancer that is mainly located_in lymph nodes.
Synonym: relapsed germ cell tumor of Ovary

Name: scarlet fever
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease described as an acute contagious disease caused by Group A bacteria of the genus Streptococcus (especially various strains of S. pyogenes) and characterized by inflammation of the nose

Name: obsolete mild degree recurrent episode manic disorder
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease described as an acute contagious disease caused by Group A bacteria of the genus Streptococcus (especially various strains of S. pyogenes) and characterized by inflammation of the nose

Name: obsolete Sezary's disease involving lymph nodes of inguinal region and lower limb
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease described as an acute contagious disease caused by Group A bacteria of the genus Streptococcus (especially various strains of S. pyogenes) and characterized by inflammation of the nose
Synonym: Szary's disease of lymph nodes of inguinal region and/or lower limb

Name: obsolete carcinoid syndrome
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease described as an acute contagious disease caused by Group A bacteria of the genus Streptococcus (especially various strains of S. pyogenes) and characterized by inflammation of the nose

Name: mucocutaneous leishmaniasis
Definition: A leishmaniasis that involves a chronic inflammatory process involving the nasal

Name: obsolete Hodgkin's lymphoma
Definition: A leishmaniasis that involves a chronic inflammatory process involving the nasal

Name: obsolete Sezary's disease involving intra-abdominal lymph nodes
Definition: A leishmaniasis that involves a chronic inflammatory process involving the nasal
Synonym: Szary's disease of intra-abdominal lymph nodes (disorder)

Name: epiglottitis
Definition: An upper respiratory tract disease which involves inflammation of the epiglottis due to infection. Haemophilus influenzae type B is the most common bacterial causative agent

Name: nasopharyngeal disease
Definition: An endocrine system disease that is located_in the adrenal gland.
